title: In a Region in Strife, India’s Moral High Ground Erodes
content: The hard-line attitude of Narendra Modi’s ruling party toward Muslims has undermined the nation’s reputation as a voice for tolerance in South Asia.

des_facet: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations

title: On Spain’s Camino de Santiago, Even Óscar the Donkey Is a Pilgrim
content: An artist and an innkeeper have enlisted the help of a burro in their effort to rescue the traditions of Spain’s ancient pilgrimage route from mass tourism (and selfies).

title: Tanker Truck Explodes in Sierra Leone, Killing at Least 98
content: The truck first started leaking fuel and people had rushed to collect it, an official said. Many of them died in the blast, along with others nearby.

more_info.byline: By Jaime Yaya Barry and Ruth Maclean

title: Spanish Police Seek Missing Plane Passengers After Emergency Landing
content: More than 20 people fled a Moroccan flight that diverted to Mallorca after a passenger apparently fell ill. A dozen had yet to be found.

title: COP26 Protesters Back an Array of Causes, Connected by Climate Change
content: Thousands gathered in the rain in Glasgow to press the case for more urgent and meaningful action by world leaders in response to global warming.

more_info.byline: By Stephen Castle and Megan Specia
des_facet: United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change

title: Near-Daily Covid Tests, Sleeping in Classrooms: Life in Covid-Zero China
content: Residents in Ruili, in southwestern China, have been locked down four times in the past year as part of the country’s quest to eliminate the virus.

more_info.byline: By Vivian Wang and Joy Dong

title: Eight Groups Join Tigray Rebels Vowing to Oust Ethiopia’s Leader
content: The government calls the new coalition, announced in Washington, a “publicity stunt,” as intermediaries try to negotiate a peaceful solution to a year of conflict.

more_info.byline: By Abdi Latif Dahir and Lara Jakes

title: First Black Woman in Bundestag Wants to Change Image of ‘Germanness’
content: After a deadly racist attack, Awet Tesfaiesus considered leaving Germany. Instead, she ran for Parliament with a “courage to change” slogan and won.

title: As Turkey Chafes at Erdogan, He Gets Spikier Abroad
content: President Recep Tayyip Erdogan canceled an appearance at the global climate talks over a perceived slight, part of a pattern of creating international dramas to bolster his domestic standing.

title: Marília Mendonça, Brazilian Pop Singer, Dies in Plane Crash at 26
content: Ms. Mendonça, who was a social media sensation with millions of followers, was iconic in a type of Brazilian country music called sertanejo.

more_info.byline: By Vimal Patel and Flávia Milhorance

title: U.N. Rights Panel Pressures Sudan Over Coup
content: The Human Rights Council appointed an expert to investigate abuses in the country since the military seized power on Oct. 25, and members called for the prime minister’s release.

des_facet: Coups D'Etat and Attempted Coups D'Etat
War Crimes, Genocide and Crimes Against Humanity

title: A Nuclear-Powered Shower? Russia Tests a Climate Innovation.
content: A remote Siberian town now has its own miniature nuclear plant as a Russian state company tests a new model for residential heating. Some see it as a tool to minimize climate change.

title: Why Is Ethiopia at War With Itself?
content: The civil war has shifted dramatically since Prime Minister Abiy Ahmed began a military campaign in the Tigray region a year ago. With Tigrayan fighters advancing toward the capital, Ethiopia is at risk of collapse.

more_info.byline: By Declan Walsh and Abdi Latif Dahir

title: How Does The New York Times Cover International News? We Asked Our Reporters.
Facing a spike in infections, Austria sharpens the rules of its Covid pass.
content: Austrians will need proof of vaccination or a past infection to be seated at a restaurant, enter a bar, visit a hairdresser or join any gathering of more than 25 people.

title: Fire in Covid intensive care ward kills 11 people in India.
content: Staff at the hospital in the western state of Maharashtra tried to douse the fire with fire extinguishers, but the flames spread quickly in the airtight room.

more_info.byline: By Hari Kumar and Emily Schmall

title: Costa Rica moves to require Covid shots for children.
content: The Central American nation’s health ministry said on Friday it was adding Covid-19 to the list of required vaccinations for people 18 and younger.

title: Activists hope protests will draw large crowds as leaders haggle in Glasgow.

more_info.byline: By Dan Bilefsky and Megan Specia

title: Manitoba Names a New Premier, but a Rival Asks a Court to Quash the Action
content: The litigation highlights the often messy process that Canadian political parties use to select their leaders.

title: John Kerry lauds progress at the climate summit but warns, ‘Job not done.’
content: Mr. Kerry, President Biden’s climate envoy, acknowledged that many of the promises being put forward in Glasgow were only that — promises.

des_facet: United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change

title: Greta Thunberg assails world leaders for ‘profiting from this destructive system.’
content: “The governments of the global north countries are still refusing to take any drastic climate action,” she told protesters in Glasgow.

more_info.byline: By Megan Specia, Stephen Castle and Jenny Gross
des_facet: United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change

title: The activist Vanessa Nakate offers an optimistic vision: ‘We won’t have to fight’ for resources.
content: The 24-year-old from Uganda has emerged as a leading voice of young people agitating for climate action.

title: Persistent shortages are stunting German economic growth.
content: The order books in Europe’s largest economy are full, but a lack of parts and raw materials means companies are struggling to fill them.

title: Ex-Macron Aide Convicted of Assault and Posing as a Police Officer
content: The aide, Alexandre Benalla, who was fired in 2018 after videos emerged of him beating a man at a labor protest, was sentenced to serve a year of house arrest with electronic monitoring.

title: 11 states sue the Biden administration over its vaccination mandate for large companies.
content: The lawsuit was filed a day after the announcement of a Jan. 4 deadline for the companies to begin their mandates or start weekly testing.

title: Vienna will start to vaccinate young children without E.U. approval.
content: Pediatricians in the Austrian capital will authorize the off-label use of the BioNTech-Pfizer vaccine for children starting next Friday.

title: ‘Justice for my daughter’: Parents issue a plea on air pollution.
content: A letter to world leaders gathered at the U.N. climate conference in Glasgow was signed by nearly 500 parent groups from 44 countries.

des_facet: United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change

title: Rights Groups Urge Singapore Not to Execute Man With Mental Disability
content: The man, a Malaysian with an I.Q. of 69, was caught trying to smuggle an ounce and a half of heroin in 2009. Some are calling his planned hanging a human rights violation.

des_facet: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations

title: Turning Back the Clock
content: After a busy week, we offer six stories that caught our eyes.

title: Japan will shorten quarantine for business travelers to 3 days.
content: The easing of rules comes as cases decline significantly. The country has virtually closed its borders since the start of the pandemic.

more_info.byline: By John Yoon and Makiko Inoue

title: Young Activists Want Action as Protesters Rally at COP26
content: For many, the climate conference has inspired mixed emotions: concern that their voices were not really being listened to, but also hope that their presence would help drive change.

more_info.byline: By Megan Specia and Stephen Castle
des_facet: United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change

title: In India, fears grow that gatherings for Diwali could prompt another virus spike.
content: Epidemiologists are concerned that Covid cases will surge after shoppers thronged markets and hundreds of thousands traveled around the country to celebrate the festival.

title: Laughs No More? Australians Are Reassessing a Beloved Cartoonist.
content: I used to think Michael Leunig’s drawings embodied the soul of our nation. Now, I’m not so sure.

title: Your Friday Briefing
content: A Covid hot spot in Italy.
